bibl.title: Letter from [Philip Showalter Hench] to Lawrence [Walter L.] Reed, October 1, 1940

div1.p: Hench requests information from Reed as to the whereabouts of Reed's father's original notes and memoranda from the yellow fever commission.

div1.head: Letter from [Philip Showalter Hench] to Lawrence [Walter L.] Reed, October 1, 1940
div1.opener:
October 1, 1940
General Walter L. Reed
405 Winder Building
Washington, D. C.
My dear General Reed:
div1.p:
On August 26, 1940, I wrote you, asking whether you
know where the original notes and memoranda of your father
and the other members of the yellow fever commission in Havana,
might be, as I had tried to locate them in the Surgeon General's
office, but nobody seemed to know anything about them.
I wondered whether my former letter had gone astray.

I would particularly appreciate knowing the address of
your mother if she is still living and of your sister.
